metadata.title: Convert Arcseconds to Degrees – Angle Converter
metadata.description: Convert angles from Arcseconds to Degrees, useful for interpreting precise astronomical measurements.

introduction: This converter transforms arcseconds to degrees for angle interpretation.
Precise astronomical measurements in arcseconds convert to degrees for perspective.
This converter uses the relationship where 3,600 arcseconds equals 1 degree.
methodology: 3,600 arcsec = 1°. To convert arcseconds to degrees, divide by 3,600.
Converting to degrees provides understanding of angle magnitude.
Understanding arcsecond-to-degree conversion bridges precision and perspective.
This converter provides precise angle conversion.

faqs.question: What's the smallest measurement?
faqs.answer: Milliarcsecond (0.001 arcsec). Gaia spacecraft measures to microarcseconds.

faqs.question: How do telescopes measure arcseconds?
faqs.answer: CCD camera plates or interferometry. Compare object positions precisely.

faqs.question: Why convert to degrees?
faqs.answer: Degrees provide context. How large is 3,600 arcsec? (1 degree).

faqs.question: Can I see 1 arcsecond?
faqs.answer: No, human eye ≈ 1 arcminute (60 arcsec) resolution without aids.

faqs.question: What instruments measure arcseconds?
faqs.answer: Telescopes with CCD cameras, interferometers, radio telescopes.

faqs.question: How is precision measured?
faqs.answer: Angular resolution = wavelength / aperture. Larger aperture = finer resolution.

faqs.question: What's Gaia satellite precision?
faqs.answer: Gaia: microarcsecond precision for millions of stars. Revolutionized astronomy.

glossary.definition: Apparent size of object from observer's perspective.
Apparent shift used to measure star distances.
